title: 24 hour ban for players who are afk majority of a ranked game
body: I'm so sick of losing because of these selfish players, so sick of being demoted in rank, Riot please...you need to put an end to this so that these people won't keep ruining everyones games. You should give a day long ban from ranked to anyone who's afk majority of the game..

Riot is entirely too nice when it comes to this and it's hurting league over all. If you can't or don't want to commit to a ranked game, then don't join one...it's that simple.

You need to see why people are leaving games. If it is being malicious or they keep playing several games after not being able to complete a game. What about the person that is being harassed? Stay out of ranked till it's fixed, others shouldn't have to suffer because of your issues. Why? because they're working hard to try and win, they're following through with their commitment to the match, both time, energy, and effort. And that absolutely should not be wasted because of an afk'r, under no circumstances.

I might get downvoted a lot, but I am just going to add my 2 cents to this discussion constructively:

I would agree with a 24 hour ban if, and only** IF**, Riot can determine the status of the player, whether it be AFK or simply has left the game.

If someone's game is not lauching for some reasons (DirectX unknown error comes to mind), internet crashing, power going off, etc. how do you manage that? How can you actually make sure the player has left the game/went AFK?

Don't get me wrong, I have been there, I have lost games to people going AFK and stuff, but yesterday I got my first game crash in YEARS and I left my friend solo ADC bottom lane while I spent near 35 mins patching the game, trying to reconnect. I got reported, had to click the "I agree" button stating I was not going to leave... Even though it was not my fault at all...

TL;DR: Yes for a 24 hours ban, **ONLY** if Riot finds a way to make a difference between a game crash and an actual on-puprpose AFKing/leaving player.
